post.content:
I've seen many Koreans and Canadians since I came to Canada. Also, I have seen extremely bad habits from Koreans.
I am going to talk about one of those today.
Do you see or glance at someone who is talking to you? Even though it is an open meeting, such a person just speak and does not pay attention (they listen maybe). You might think that you don't, but are you sure?
I found out several people do that way in our community, too. I don't know what he/she intend for doing so. But why do you harm yourself? Perhaps it is very natural for him/her, but it seems they are rude and neglecting people. How about you?
Unfortunately, the stereotype caused by a unconscious habit will last very longer (than you expect), and it is generally impossible to eliminate or recover it by your own effort although it is in a severe situation. But, usually, you will not perceive that you gave any chanes to people, or not know how to solve the uncomfortable relation.
I'm not talking about the first impression. If you don't pay positive attention in communication, it means that you despise people. Let's try not to trap yourself just showing indifference.
post.title: Bad habit(1)
